issue.title: Container requirements tables should distinguish const and non-const variables

blockquote.p: In Tables 83, 84, and 85 X denotes a container class containing objects of type T, a and b denote values of type X, u denotes an identifier, r denotes a non-const value of type X, and rv denotes a non-const rvalue of type X.

discussion.p: This doesn't say anything about whether a and b are allowed to be const, or must be non-const. In fact Table 83 uses them inconsistently, e.g. the rows for "a = rv" and "a.swap(b)" most certainly require them to be non-const, but all other uses are valid for either const or non-const X.
Priority set to 2; Jonathan to provide updated wording.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4687.
